node.title: At 75, the Queen of Netherlands sat down for dinner. The next day she lost her title
node.alt: Four people in formal clothes sit at a long table decorated with flowers with a large oil painting in the background
node.description: In 2013, not long after turning 75, Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands hosted a dinner party. What happened next changed the course of history and some people think the British royal family should take note.
node.content:
["In 2013, not long after turning 75, Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands hosted a dinner party.", "The guest list, featuring\u00a0members of the Dutch royal family and foreign royalty including the Duke and Duchess of Wales.\u00a0Frederick and Mary, the Crown Prince and Princess of Denmark, were also there. Everyone was dressed in their royal best, complete with medals, sashes and priceless jewels. Crown Princess Mary wore her wedding tiara.", "The group sat around a large table, eating and drinking,\u00a0in one of the central halls of Amsterdam's Reijksmuseum, surrounded by the paintings of Dutch masters.", "Half-close your eyes and the event, with all its pomp and privilege, could have been extracted from any moment of history.", "Perhaps it was.", "", "
Queen Beatrix arriving at her abdication eve dinner.(Reuters: Robin Utrecht)
", "The Dutch Queen's dinner recognised her last night as monarch.", "The following morning, at the Moses Hall inside the Royal Palace in Amsterdam\u00a0\u00a0before a crowd that included the royal family, the Dutch political cabinet and foreign dignitaries, a royal official sat on a gilded\u00a0chair and\u00a0read aloud the \"instruments of abdication\".", "When he had finished Queen Beatrix signed a document which read: \"I declare that I hereby step down from the monarchy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands, that the monarchy from this moment on is transferred to my eldest son and heir Willem-Alexander, Prince of Orange, in accordance with the statutes and the constitution of the Kingdom of the Netherlands.\"", "", "
The signed act of abdication of Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands allowed\u00a0 her eldest son Willem-Alexander to take the throne.(Reuters/pool)
", "And that was that.\u00a0After 33 years on the throne, Beatrix was no longer Queen.", "On April 30, 2013, Willem-Alexander, who had turned 46 just a few days earlier, had replaced her.", "\"Some moments ago I abdicated from the throne,\" the emotional former monarch said. \"I am happy and thankful to present to you your new king.\"", "Rather than a moment of anguish, the abdication and succession were celebrated with street parties. Collectible mugs and plates featuring\u00a0the faces of the former queen and new king and his queen were produced.", "", "
Dutch King Willem-Alexander and his wife Queen Maxima after being crowned.(Reuters: Jasper Juinen/Pool\u00a0)
", "Willem-Alexander became the first king of the Netherlands since 1890 and as a father of three daughters, he's also likely to be the last for some time.", "No doubt Queen Beatrix remembered her own sentiments as a younger women keen to take up the role she was born to when making her decision.", "In the 1970s, a few years before she ascended to the throne in 1980, Bea (as she is known to friends) is reported to have said: \"I have been trained for the job of queen all my life. It's simply not fair to let me wait so long.\"", "", "
At 73, Prince Charles is still first in line to the throne.(Reuters: Richard Pohle/Pool)
", "
A Queen for life?
", "Unlike Britain, where the monarch generally stays in power until death, abdication has become something of a tradition in Holland.", "At 73 Prince Charles, still first in line to the British throne and never having ruled, is just shy of the age Beatrix was when she abdicated.", "Queen Beatrix followed a pattern set by her grandmother Queen Wilhelmina (who became Queen aged 10 and spent 60 years on the throne), and mother Queen Juliana (32 years as monarch), in deciding to abdicate.", "At the ceremony authorising her abdication she explained that \"the reason for me to step back now is not because the office is too much of a strain [it is not]. I am abdicating because I am convinced that the responsibility for our country should now move to the next generation,\" adding her son was ready for the job.", "Dutch journalist Joris Luyendijk recounted overhearing Queen Beatrix discussing abdication with a UK diplomat a few years before she announced her plans.", "She explained how much she had appreciated her mother allowing her time to raise her children before abdicating when Beatrix was in her 40s \u2013 old enough to have had time to devote to being a mother and yet young enough to feel she could take on her royal role without the endless waiting that others have faced.", "Luyendijk pondered whether there was something \"unhealthily martyrish about the British 'Queen for Life' system\".", "", "
Prince Charles was only three when his mother, Elizabeth, became Queen.(AFP)
", "
Retiring life
", "Whether it is martyrdom or a duty to serve remains up for debate, but there can be no doubt that the British royals are increasingly alone in this tradition.", "Since 2000 a number of high-profile royals \u2013 like Queen Beatrix \u2013 have selected abdication as a way of managing succession.", "Here are some key royal movements since 2000.", "Jean, the Grand Duke of Luxembourg, abdicated for his son Henri in 2000.", "In 2004 King Norodom Sihanouk abdicated so that his son Norodm Sihamoni could take the throne.", "In 2006 Kuwait's Emir Saad Al-Abdullah Al-Salim Al-Sabah was voted out of office. He then chose to abdicate.", "Ismail Petra of Kelantan, Sultan of Kelantan was succeeded by his son Mohammad V of Kelantan in 2010 when he abdicated because of illness.", "King Albert II passed the throne to his son Philippe upon abdicating in 2013.", "Emir Hamad bin Khalifa also abdicated in favour of his son in 2013. Tamim bin Hamad succeeded the throne.", "King Juan Carlos I abdicated to make way for his son Filipe VI in 2014.", "", "
Japan's new emperor formally proclaims ascension to throne
", "Emperor Akihito abdicated for his son Naruhito in 2019", "Muhhammad V of Kelantan, Yang di-Pertuan Agong XV, gave no reason when he abdicated in 2019 after only nine years in the job. Ahmad Shah of Pahang, Sultan of Pahang took over but little more than a week later he too abdicated as a result of illness. His abdication was decided by the Royal Council and Ahmad Shah's son Abdullah of Pahang took over.", "
Is abdication becoming more popular?
", "Abdications appear to have picked up pace in recent years \u2013 perhaps in line with the changing influence of royal families alongside the dismantling of traditional social hierarchies that includes a more casual, less formal way of living and elected governments taking over political power from royalty which retain a mostly ceremonial role.", "A debate over the place of inherited wealth and titles in the 21st century has also raised questions for some over the purpose of royal tradition.", "Acknowledging this shift, King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands said when he took over the role that he wanted to \"be a king that can bring society together, representative and encouraging in the 21st century\". He added that he did not expect to be called \"Your Majesty\".", "Since 2000 around 11 monarchs have abdicated, compared with just one in the 1990s (the King of Lesotho), one in the 1980s (Queen Juliana of the Netherlands) and two in the 1970s (the King of Afghanistan and King of Laos who both lost their thrones when the monarchy was abolished).", "In the 1960s, four monarchs abdicated from Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Luxembourg and Brunei.", "The very first monarch to abdicate is said to have been the Roman general and dictator\u00a0Lucius Cornelius Sulla Felix who left the job in 79BC and withdrew to his villa near Naples.\u00a0", "His biographer, Plutarch, wrote that Sulla spent his final days consorting with \"actresses, harpists, and theatrical people, drinking with them on couches all day long\" before dying of liver failure.", "A large funeral was held in Rome and his epitaph, a sign of the brutal times in which he lived,\u00a0read\u00a0\"No friend ever served me, and no enemy ever wronged me, whom I have not repaid in full.\""]
